result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen Dean Vest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1694.00 fine must be paid on or before July 27, 2016 or a 34 day jail committment may be imposed.
$50.00 IID Surcharge must be paid on or before July 27, 2016.

245 days jail imposed. 101 days jail are stayed pending successful completion of IDIP program. The remaining 144 days will be served, 29 days in the Pierce County Jail. 3 days credit ; which will serve as his 48 hour without huber and Defendant maybe released on huber tomorrow for work. 115 days on electronic monitoring which will start at the end of the 29 days jail sentence.
Concurrent with: Ct#1

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY  IID for a period of 2 yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.
Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed

2:22  Defendant Glen Dean Vest in court with attorney Angela Raye Olson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie - Defendant wants to complete the IDIP program. Ct 1 Resisting arrest.  Thorie asks for 10 days conc to sentence in Ct 2.  Follow IDIP guidelines for Ct 2.  
  
Court orders  Ct 1
 $1694.00  Fine  6 Months to pay fine. 
 24 Months Revocation of Driver License  Credit for administrative  suspension. 
 245   Days Jail are Imposed.  101 Days Jail are Stayed pending successful completion of the IDIP Program. The remaining 144  days will be served  29 days in the Pierce Co Jail with 3 days credit which will serve as his 48 hours w/o huber. Defendant may be released on huber tomorrow for work.   115 days on electronic monitoring which will start at the end of the 29 days jail sentence
Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed
IID must be installed for a period of 2 years. $50.00 IID Surcharge is imposed. The IID requirement will commence when the defendant obtains any type of drivers license or when the defendant decides to drive w/o a valid driver license.
Defendant must complete the victim impact panel at the SCVRJ.
A violation of the IDIP rules while on Electronic Home Monitoring may be a cause for a contempt of court proceeding, may also be a basis for arrest and may be cause for termination from the IDIP program.
Ct 2  Resisting  Charge  10 days jail conc to the jail sentence in Ct 1.
from Samantha Brill recommending Mr Vest be considered for the Pierce County IDIP Sentencing guidelines.
Sentencing hearing at 12-28-2015 02:15 pm.
from Atty Olson re: requesting sentencing be continued for Def to be on IDIP program for 90 days.
Victim Impact Panel Registration/Verification
Sentencing hearing at 09-21-2015 02:15 pm.

8:39  This includes 14TR585, 14TR586  Defendant Glen Dean Vest in court with attorney Angela Raye Olson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie files an amended information.  Defdendant will plead to 2 charges in amended information . 14TR585 and 14TR586 Will be dismissed.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 and 2 of the amended information    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 & 2.  Sentencing date will be set. Thorie  moves to amend the offense date on the amended information to 
 August 16, 2014 for Ct 2 . Court accepts the amendment.  Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.  Dismiss 14TR585 and 14tr586

9:33 a.m.  Includes 14TR585 and 14TR586. Defendant Glen Dean Vest in court with attorney Angela Raye Olson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - still on track for jury trial on June 5, 2015.  Olson agrees.  Thorie will draft amended information as to count 2.  Should be felony.  Jury fee has not been paid for 14TR585 and 14TR586 to they would be trial to the court.

Defendant enters not guilty plea on all counts at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty plea received by the court.  The bond will continue as ordered. 02:39 Defendant Glen Dean Vest in court with attorney Angela Raye Olson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14TR585 & 14TR586 are heard at this time.  Dep Robbie Jaeger swn & ex by Thorie.  Id's def. Ex #1- Lab results off/rec. Atty Olson x-ex. Atty Olson gives argument. Atty Thories gives argument. 3:59 Defendant Glen Dean Vest in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: Def missed preliminary court date. Def explains missed court date. Thorie: no objection to quashing the warrant and resetting preliminary hearing. No objection to reinstating signature bond. Court: quashes warrant. reinstate original bond with it's original conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Glen Dean Vest not in Court.  ADA William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy R. Jaeger present.  Case called at 4:04 p.m.  Set for Preliminary Hearing at 3:45 p.m.  Hearing set for 14TR586.  ADA Thorie notes time limit was waived and Preliminary Hearing set.  State requests bench warrant, body only.  Court questions 14TR586 and default;  State requests forfeiture.  Court find Defendant in default and enters judgment of $263.50 forfeiture, 60 days to pay.
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Def voluntarily waives his time limits for preliminary hearing
